en.section-sobre-mi-p: Data & AI Engineer specialized in workflow optimization and the integration of predictive models for decision-making. Expert in the data lifecycle: from ingestion using Cloud architectures (Azure) and SQL, to advanced visualization in Power BI. With a strong engineering background, I combine Python automation and containerization (Docker) to scale Artificial Intelligence solutions.
en.proyecto-1-p: Analysis focused on the Human Talent area to identify patterns of turnover, evaluating factors such as tenure, job satisfaction, performance, and other internal variables.
en.proyecto-2-p: Report focusing on income based on treatments, sterilization status, and services. Allows visualizing how these factors affect economic performance.
en.proyecto-3-p: Local LLM optimized for programming tasks. Used as a key assistant in the IEEE Xtreme 19.0 competition, demonstrating utility under time pressure.
en.proyecto-4-p: ProGAN-based project. Training from scratch exploring generative architecture. Promising initial results limited by high hardware demand.
en.proyecto-5-p: Resolution of all problems from the 24-hour IEEEXtreme 19.0 competition. Used Python, C, and C++. Competition usually done in teams of 3, completed individually.
en.proyecto-6-p: Data Science project focused on building several advanced models capable of predicting the survival probability of Titanic passengers. It includes a complete pipeline: exploratory analysis, data cleaning, feature engineering, and modeling with XGBoost, achieving highly stable performance through cross-validation (RMSE ‚âà 0.056). The image below shows the top performing models found for this problem and the most relevant survival features. Here, the passenger title stands out with almost 60% influence on whether a person would have survived or not.
en.proyecto-7-p: Developed a predictive system to anticipate accidents by analyzing human, environmental, and operational factors. The model identifies hidden risk patterns, enabling smart resource optimization and proactive safety alerts. By implementing XGBoost and rigorous residual analysis, I ensured a high-accuracy, unbiased model that provides reliable insights for critical safety decision-making.
en.proyecto-7-p-2: Below are two representative images of the project: the first shows a comparison of the predictive models used, highlighting their performance and precision in accident prediction. The second image illustrates the most influential factors contributing to accident occurrence, providing key insights for prevention and risk mitigation. Residual Analysis ensures the model is robust. The normal, zero-centered error distribution rules out systematic biases (e.g., risk underestimation), which is vital for critical decision-making.
